a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: Share in poverty vs. life expectancy, 2020
Poverty is measured as the share of the population living on less than $3.65 per day. Life expectancy is measured as
the average number of years a newborn would live if age-specific mortality rates in the current year were to stay the
Share of population below $3.65 per day
Data source: United Nations Population Division and others (via World Bank); World Bank Poverty and Inequality Platform (2022)
Note: Poverty data is expressed in international-$ at 2017 prices. Depending on the country and year, it relates to income measured after
taxes and benefits, or to consumption, per capita.
